And on a trade deadline day where moves were getting made right up until the last possible moment, the Denver Nuggets took a big swing at getting better for a playoff run while the Orlando Magic began a rebuild.

title: NBA rejects criticism it is caving to China following tweet-induced controversy
description: Victims of Communism Executive Director Marion Smith says we see time and time again bending to the power and money that Beijing has.

title: Tucker Carlson: 'Woke' NBA shows that China's fascism is good for business and bad for our freedom
description: In the age of "woke," capital, corporations sell out America to its Chinese masters for the almighty dollar.

title: Basketball Hall of Famer Mitch Richmond's son, 20, dies suddenly
description: The son of Basketball Hall of Famer Mitch Richmond died suddenly Monday night, the Golden State Warriors announced.

title: Pro-Hong Kong NBA fan booted from Philadelphia 76ers preseason game against Chinese team
description: A Philadelphia 76ers fan said Wells Fargo Center security ejected him and his wife from the stands Tuesday after they brought in pro-Hong Kong signage for a preseason game against Guangzhou Loong Lions.

title: Miami Heat's Pat Riley defends sending James Johnson home over failure to meet conditioning goal
description: Miami Heat president of basketball operations Pat Riley on Monday defended sending forward James Johnson home from training camp after he failed to meet his weight goal.

title: Kevin Durant: New York Knicks brand 'not as cool' as Brooklyn Nets
description: Kevin Durant ruffled the feathers of New York Knicks fans when he chose to sign with the Brooklyn Nets over the team that plays at the basketball Mecca and he did it again Tuesday in a radio interview.

title: San Antonio Spurs' Gregg Popovich hits Trump while expressing support for Adam Silver amid China row
description: San Antonio Spurs coach Gregg Popovich broke his silence Wednesday amid the NBA’s row with China over a general manager’s tweet supporting the protesters in Hong Kong.

title: NBA commissioner defends free speech after China halts NBA broadcasts
description: China halts broadcasts over Hong Kong tweet; reaction from Mike Gunzleman, host of 'The Gunz Show.'

title: Second NBA Cares event canceled in China during Lakers-Nets preseason visit: report
description: An NBA Cares event scheduled for Wednesday in Shanghai that was supposed to feature players from the Los Angeles Lakers has been canceled, according to a report.

title: NBA-China controversy exposed how dependent American basketball is on Beijing, FS1's Jason Whitlock says
description: The controversy unleashed after Houston Rockets general manager Daryl Morey expressed public support for the Hong Kong pro-democracy protests revealed the NBA's strong dependence on China, according to Jason Whitlock.

title: Outspoken basketball coach Steve Kerr blasted after declining to comment on NBA-China controversy
description: Golden State Warriors head coach Steve Kerr has come in for some intense criticism online after he declined to comment on the ongoing controversy between the NBA and China.

title: NBA apologizes to China over a tweet showing support for Hong Kong protests
description: NBA tries to play both sides in China dustup; reaction from FS1's 'Speak for Yourself' host Jason Whitlock.

title: Tucker: We live in the age of 'woke' capital
description: Houston Rockets general manager tweeted support for Hong Kong, NBA commissioner tries to play both sides.

title: ESPN's Keith Olbermann attacks NBA star for apologizing to China: 'Embarrassing beyond words'
description: ESPN anchor Keith Olbermann had scathing criticism for NBA star James Harden after he apologized to China over his team general manager expressing support for Hong Kong protesters.

title: New York Knicks' Marcus Morris ejected from first preseason game of season for hitting defender in head
description: New York Knicks newcomer Marcus Morris was ejected from the first preseason game of the year against the Washington Wizards on Monday after hitting an opponent with the basketball.

title: NBA's Hong Kong, China balancing act includes silence from typically outspoken basketball crowd
description: In the era of "woke" athletes, the NBA has staked its claim as the most vocal and progressive among the major American sports -- yet many of those same outspoken athletes and coaches praised by the media for their strong, unequivocal pronouncements on everything from gun control to civil rights to President Trump are suddenly silent when it comes to China.

title: Adam Silver addresses NBA's China, Hong Kong controversy and says league won't regulate free speech
description: Amid growing backlash against NBA owners for siding with deep-pocketed Beijing powerbrokers over one of their own employees -- who was rebuked for a pro-Hong Kong protest tweet -- the league's commissioner released a statement Tuesday morning seeking to clarify the NBA's relationship with the controversial communist country.

title: Former NBA player Brock Gillespie makes case to keep politics out of sports
description: Former NBA player and owner of a large basketball business in China Brock Gillespie weighs in on the backlash over the Houston Rockets GM showing his support for Hong Kong.

title: NBA Draft bust resurfaces with new look in Serbian basketball league
description: Darko Milicic is considered to be one of the biggest NBA Draft busts in the league’s history after the Detroit Pistons selected him with the No. 2 pick in 2003 after LeBron James and before Carmelo Anthony, Chris Bosh and Dwyane Wade.

title: Agent: Raptors, Lowry agree on $31 million extension
description: Kyle Lowry and the Toronto Raptors have agreed on a $31 million, one-year extension that could keep him with the NBA champions through the 2020-21 season.

title: Chinese government cancels Nets event, won't broadcast NBA preseason games after tweet fallout: report
description: The Chinese government canceled a Brooklyn Nets event on Tuesday in wake of recent controversy over Rockets general manager Daryl Morey’s tweet supporting protesters in the Hong Kong riots, according to reports.

title: Ingraham: The communists' full-court press
description: NBA loves free speech except when money is involved.

title: NBA under fire for apologizing to China over tweet
description: Chinese sponsors paused ad deals, broadcaster threatened not to air games; 'Hillbilly Elegy' author J.D. Vance reacts.

title: 'South Park' creators offer tongue-in-cheek 'apology' to China after show gets banned: 'We cool now?'
description: The creators of "South Park" offered a tongue-in-cheek apology to China after its latest episode mocked the Communist government's control over Hollywood, causing a ban of the long-running animated series in the country.

title: NBA's controversy with China is all about money, shouldn't be surprising to anyone, Jesse Watters says
description: The controversy over the National Basketball Association and China intensified Monday in part because of the financial factor involved, according to Jesse Watters.

title: Ted Cruz knocks NBA in tweet defending 'South Park' in China
description: Sen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, continued to assail the NBA and China on Monday, tweeting his support of "South Park," which was banned from China after a recent episode critical of the Communist government, and at the same time criticizing the league for its perceived capitulation to Beijing.

title: NBA faces bipartisan backlash over China apology
description: U.S. politicians call out NBA for 'kowtowing' to China; reaction on 'The Five.'

title: Senator calls on NBA to cancel games in China amid growing controversy
description: Missouri Sen. Josh Hawley has called on the NBA to cancel its high-profile preseason games in China amid growing controversy over a team official’s pro-Hong Kong statement.

title: NBA under fire after Rockets GM tweets support for Hong Kong
description: The NBA is trying to backtrack a since-deleted tweet by the Houston Rockets GM in support of protesters in Hong Kong after receiving backlash from China.

title: Chinese Basketball Association cancels Houston Rockets G-League team's game amid row: report
description: The Chinese Basketball Association reportedly canceled a planned exhibition game between two of the NBA’s G-League teams in response to the Houston Rockets’ social media row.

title: Private plane carrying Sacramento Kings officials struck by lightning on trip back from India
description: A private plane carrying members of the Sacramento Kings’ organization was struck by lightning Sunday as the personnel was traveling back to the U.S. from their historic trip to India.

title: Houston Rockets' James Harden apologizes to China amid row over tweet: 'We love China'
description: Houston Rockets star James Harden offered an apology to China on Monday, days after the team’s general manager Daryl Morey tweeted support of Hong Kong protesters.

title: Chinese suspend work with Houston Rockets after GM's Hong Kong tweet
description: China's basketball association says it will suspend cooperation with the Houston Rockets following a tweet over the weekend by the General Manager of the Rockets, Daryl Morey in support of the protesters in Hong Kong.

title: Celtics' Enes Kanter says he was harassed at mosque by Erdogan supporters
description: Boston Celtics center Enes Kanter has claimed he was attacked and threatened at a Boston-area mosque on Friday by supporters of Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

title: Brother of NBA star Nikola Jokic arrested for allegedly choking, pushing woman
description: The brother of Denver Nuggets star Nikola Jokic was arrested last week for allegedly choking and pushing a woman as she tried to leave his apartment.

title: NBA referees aim to make traveling take a walk
description: James Harden slides sideways or steps backward, and the screaming starts.

title: Philadelphia 76ers' Mike Scott addresses tailgate fight: 'I definitely should have walked away'
description: Philadelphia 76ers forward Mike Scott addressed the altercation he got into when he went to support his favorite NFL team, the Washington Redskins, as they took on the Philadelphia Eagles.

title: LeBron James says California's college athletes compensation law 'personal' for him
description: LeBron James said Monday that California’s decision to sign a bill into law that would give student-athletes in the state the chance to make money on their name was “personal” for him.

title: Los Angeles Clippers' Kawhi Leonard showered with boos during Los Angeles Rams game
description: Kawhi Leonard probably didn’t expect to be showered with boos upon one of his first public appearances as a member of the Los Angeles Clippers.

title: Brooklyn Nets' Kevin Durant celebrates birthday at Dave & Buster's
description: Kevin Durant might be superhuman on the court but off the court, he appears to enjoy the same things mere mortals do – especially on his birthday.

title: Brooklyn Nets' Kyrie Irving reveals death of grandfather weighed heavily on him last season
description: Newest Brooklyn Nets star Kyrie Irving admitted Friday at a press conference the death of his grandfather weighed heavily on him last season and it affected his decision to leave Boston.
